rrr for Linear Discriminant Analysis

Chris Addy

2016-11-29

Mathematical Background

LDA is a Special Case of CVA

Linear discriminant analysis is a classification procedure. We can turn it into a regression procedure – specifically a reduced-rank canonical variate procedure – in the following way.

Let each \(i = 1, 2, \dots, n\) observation observationbelong to one, and only one, of \(K = s + 1\) distinct classes.

We can construct an indicator response matrix, \(\mathbf{Y}\)

\[ \mathbf{Y} \]

### create training and test sets
set.seed(12345)
num_obs <- dim(digits)[1]
train_number <- floor(.75 * num_obs)
train_index <- sample(num_obs, train_number)

### training set
train_digits_features <- digits_features[train_index, ]
train_digits_class <- digits_class[train_index, ]

### test set
test_digits_features <- digits_features[-train_index, ]
test_digits_class <- digits_class[-train_index, ]

Assesss Effective Dimensionality

Diagnostics

Fit LDA Model

Fit LDA model with lda()

lda(digits_features, digits_class, rank = 3)
